image.altText: A court sketch of a man with glasses sitting in the dock

props.synopsis: A man who shot an unarmed trespasser four times at close range before burying him two metres underground inside a shed north of Adelaide in 2023 is found guilty of murder.Â

title.children: Man found guilty of murdering unarmed trespasser he buried in shed

image.altText: Shiraz grapes on the vine at the Kalleske winery in South Australia.

props.synopsis: Farmers in Australia's largest wine grape regions are calling on the federal government to implement a mandatory code of conduct immediately to stop a mass exodus of growers.

title.children: Wine grape growers demand safeguards for industry in 'crisis'

image.altText: Firefighters in the field.

props.synopsis: South Australians are warned to prepare for an extended high-risk bushfire season across several districts as hot, dry conditions show no signs of abating.

title.children: No end in sight to SA bushfire danger after record dry spell

image.altText: A primary school-aged boy standing inside a room of a house and smiling.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man in South Australia after a 12-year-old Alice Springs boy, missing since Thursday, was found safe and well in Coober Pedy.

title.children: Missing 12-year-old Alice Springs boy found in Coober Pedy, man arrested

image.altText: AFL player Zak Butters running and dropping the football, preparing to punt it away

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide vice-captain Zak Butters will be sidelined for at least six weeks after having knee surgery.

title.children: Power vice-captain to miss several matches following surgery

image.altText: A building at Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: The SA government had been pursuing GFG Alliance over unpaid royalties since the beginning of last year â and made repeated threats to suspend the company's mining permits, according to documents obtained under Freedom of Information.

title.children: SA government had been chasing GFG Alliance over debts since early 2024

image.altText: A little corella looks down from a gum tree

props.synopsis: Kangaroo Island residents say their children are at risk of disease from little corella poo splashing across play equipment and school lunch areas, but the education department refuses to consider a cull.Â

title.children: 'Thousands and thousands' of little corellas causing big poo problem

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis gives thumbs up in a bed

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis has undergone surgery to try to correct the "mental and physical torture" he was suffering through a long-standing pectoral injury.Â

title.children: Kokkinakis has surgery in bid to end 'mental and physical torture'

image.altText: A woman and man with serious expressions stand close together in front of a caravan park

props.synopsis: After rebuilding their Riverland caravan park in the wake of a devastating flood, Barbara and Geoff Calvert are facing a new challenge â surging insurance premiums.Â

title.children: South Australians deal with rising insurance premiums following floods and fires

image.altText: Stewart Johnston, standing in a crowd, frowns as he speaks to reporters.

props.synopsis: Stewart Johnston, who remained a high-profile advocate for reform in the aged care sector following the abuse scandal at Oakden, has been sentenced to just over a year in jail after earlier pleading guilty to a charge of knowingly possessing child exploitation material.

title.children: Oakden campaigner Stewart Johnston jailed for possessing child exploitation material

image.altText: overhead satellite photo of houses adjacent sand dunes

props.synopsis: A Tennyson resident says plans for a coastal walk from Grange to Tennyson reveal a 40-metre blockage in the dunes that link it to Stage One of the project.

title.children: Adelaide walkway plans show 'blockage' in beach suburb dunes

image.altText: Young smiling girl, braces wears blue tee with surf culture australia written, holds surfboard, house, white sand in background.

props.synopsis: Home Education Association says the number of people choosing to homeschool their children is growing. However, an academic warns it may not be for everyone.

title.children: Why do so many Australians homeschool their children?

image.altText: A man hunches over a reel-to-reel tape player.

props.synopsis: Samuel Beckett's plays challenged the norm in the mid-20th century, so it's fitting that a director who champions new writers should open the Adelaide Festival with his major work, Krapp's Last Tape.

title.children: Samuel Beckett an ongoing champion for new writing at Adelaide Festival

image.altText: A fishing boat listing on the ocean after crashing into rocks.

props.synopsis: Beaches at a popular New South Wales Far South Coast tourist town have become littered with debris after a commercial fishing vessel ran aground this week.

title.children: Idyllic beaches littered with debris and diesel from NSW shipwreck

image.altText: A man in a police uniform, with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Queensland Police Commissioner Steve Gollschewski will step down immediately after being diagnosed with cancer.

title.children: Queensland's police commissioner to step down after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A black building with a big red 7 logo

props.synopsis: The company which has launched an Australian version of the US right-wing streaming channel Newsmax says its latest acquisition, which includes a raft of TV stations, will be run separately to that operation.

title.children: Conservative news operator takes over 7 Tasmania, other television assets

image.altText: Penny Wong speaks while standing in front of US and Australian flags

props.synopsis: Beijing has signalled a remarkable shift in approach towards Canberra, one that appears aimed at bolstering Labor's prospects in the looming federal election.

title.children: China credits Labor, not the Coalition, with 'digging the well'

image.altText: A graphic showing a man coughing, a rapid antigen COVID test and three spike proteins

props.synopsis: A study of hundreds of thousands of people hospitalised from COVID has shown increased risk of death more than two years after infection.

title.children: New research reveals long-term health impact of COVID-19

image.altText: an art deco brick apartment building against a blue sky

props.synopsis: Ceiling motifs inspired by Australian flora, koalas carved by hand into the fireplaces, stained glass windows â the city's "most modern" apartments were something from another world. Â

title.children: The changing world around one of Australia's first 'art deco' apartments

image.altText: A man sits on someones shoulders among a crowd at a concert, holding up a large sign.

props.synopsis: At Drake's Brisbane concert this week, Byron Ayton held up a sign that read: "Mum's Cancer Treatment," but the 23-year-old from Port Macquarie couldn't believe it when the star singled him out with a promise to help.

title.children: NSW woman 'blown away' by rapper Drake's offer to cover cancer costs

image.altText: A group of male students stand around a Sheikh wearing traditional Islamic garments, outside a school.

props.synopsis: Students have welcomed back support officer Sheikh Wesam Charkawi days after he was barred from work over alleged breaches to the education department's social media policy.

title.children: Sheikh allowed to return to work at Sydney school after students protest

image.altText: IMAGE Rose Girone FB profile pic

props.synopsis: Rose Girone, the woman believed to be the oldest known Holocaust survivor, has died, her family has confirmed.Â

title.children: Rose Girone, world's oldest known Holocaust survivor, dies at 113

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Nicole Williams pleaded guilty to attempted aggravated burglary and accessory after the fact to murder for her involvement in the death of Glenn Walewicz, and was today sentenced to seven years in jail.

title.children: It was a killing that baffled police. Now its mastermind has been jailed

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Screenshot 2025-02-27 at 3.21.39â¯PM

props.synopsis: Senator Jacqui Lambie allowed ABC NEWS Verify to use inexpensive AI tools to create a robocall with her voice ahead of the federal election â it was good enough to fool some of her supporters. Â

title.children: Voters were convinced by our AI robocall about the election. It cost $100

image.altText: A close up of Andrew Tate speaking into a reporter's microphone at an airport

props.synopsis: The brothers are facing serious charges in Romania and are being sued in the UK for over allegations of sexual violence and physical abuse.Â

title.children: Accused rapist Andrew Tate flies to the US after travel restrictions lifted

image.altText: A crowd in 70s fashion dance through a street at nighttime.

props.synopsis: The new footage of the first Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras parade in 1978 shows crowds of revellers clad in capes and flags, contrasted with violent arrests by police.

title.children: Footage of first Sydney Mardi Gras parade unearthed after almost 50 years

image.altText: The Northern Territory Supreme Court in Darwin.

props.synopsis: A mentally ill man indefinitely detained in a Darwin prison is "treading water, if not going backwards", with a government staffer now due to testify about his care after a judge labelled it "completely, obviously, unacceptable".

title.children: Mentally ill prisoner indefinitely detained after secure centre closes

image.altText: A woman in a pink dress stands with a man. The man has his arm around her

props.synopsis: The third anniversary of Chris "Willow" Wilson's death in a helicopter crash has been marked with stirring words by his widow, Danielle Wilson. It comes as Mr Wilson's co-star Matt Wright is due to face trial later this year on one count of perverting the course of justice.

title.children: 'Spirit lives on': Netflix star's widow shares tribute ahead of trial

image.altText: Ryan Peake swings a golf club

props.synopsis: Western Australia's Ryan Peake is a chance to take out the New Zealand Open despite never having seen the Millbrook Resort course due to a hugely disrupted preparation for the tournament.

title.children: Ex-Rebels bikie overcomes visa issues to surge into NZ Open contention

image.altText: Siosiua Taukeiaho runs with the ball in his right hand

props.synopsis: Siosiua Taukeiaho is back in the NRL after being handed a lifeline by the Manly Sea Eagles, but feared his time in the league was done after choosing a concert over training in the UK.

title.children: Manly star feared NRL dream was over after pop concert 'embarrassment'

image.altText: Runny paoched eggs on toast with tomato.

props.synopsis: Egg farmers and market analysts warn increased consumer demand and ongoing avian influenza issues are to blame for current egg shortages, which could continue for at least another three years.

title.children: Egg prices likely to remain high as shortage tipped to last for years

image.altText: An orange logo on a phone screen that says TEMU in front of a separate computer screen showing a 90 per cent off deal.

props.synopsis: It had a meteoric rise to become the most downloaded shopping app worldwide in 2024, but Temu's expansion plans hit roadblocks in some South-East Asian countries.

title.children: Temu wants to 'serve the world' but it can't sell to 280 million Indonesians

image.altText: A woman and two children stand kneedeep in water. One is holding a fishing rod.

props.synopsis:
Peak fishing bodies are at odds with Labor's stance on mandatory catch reporting, which some say is an irresponsible bid to secure votes from recreational anglers.

Â

title.children: WA Labor accused of 'grubby deal' that could lead to fish extinction
